text.0: the car that was not made for horses or for reins threewheeled worthy of lauds rolls round the firmament.
text.1: that is the great announcement of your deity that o ye Ṛbhus ye sustain the earth and heaven.
text.2: ye sapient ones who made the lightlyrolling car out of your mind by thought the car that never errs.
text.3: you being such to drink of this drinkoffering you o ye vājas and ye Ṛbhus we invoke.
text.4: o vājas Ṛbhus reaching far among the gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared.
text.5: in that your aged parents worn with length of days ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.
text.6: the chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold and by your wisdom brought the cow forth from the hide.
text.7: so quickly mid the gods ye gained immortal life vājas and Ṛbhus your great work must be extolled.
text.8: wealth from the Ṛbhus is most glorious in renown that which the heroes famed for vigour have produced.
text.9: in synods must be sung the car which vibhvan wrought that which ye favour gods is famed among mankind.
text.10: strong is the steed the man a sage in eloquence the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight.
text.11: great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom vāja vibhvan Ṛbhus have looked kindly on.
text.12: to you hath been assigned the fairest ornament the hymn of praise vājas and Ṛbhus joy therein.
text.13: for ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill as such with this our prayer we call on you to come.
text.14: according to the wishes of our hearts may ye who have full knowledge of all the delights of men.
text.15: fashion for us o Ṛbhus power and splendid wealth rich in high courage excellent and vital strength.
text.16: bestowing on us here riches and offspring here fashion fame for us befitting heroes.
text.17: vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort o Ṛbhus that we may make us more renowned than others.
